Xerath (Astronaut Xerath)

RP Cost: 1350 RP

Release Date: July 2021

League of Legends is known for its diverse and imaginative skins, and Astronaut Xerath is no exception. This interstellar-themed skin takes the powerful Ascended Magus, Xerath, and transforms him into a cosmic being ready to conquer the universe. With its stunning visual effects and unique animations, Astronaut Xerath is a must-have skin for any Xerath enthusiast.

The Story Behind Astronaut Xerath

The Astronaut Xerath skin is part of the larger Astronaut skin line, which features champions exploring the vastness of space. In this skin, Xerath is depicted as an otherworldly being, harnessing the power of the stars to unleash devastating cosmic energy on the Rift.

The skin showcases Xerath in a futuristic astronaut suit, complete with a sleek helmet and a high-tech staff. The suit is adorned with intricate details, such as glowing blue accents and cosmic patterns, giving Xerath an ethereal and majestic appearance. The visual effects of the skin are particularly impressive, with Xerath's abilities transformed into cosmic explosions and celestial energy.

One of the standout features of Astronaut Xerath is his recall animation. When recalling, Xerath activates his jetpack and floats above the ground, surrounded by a swirling galaxy. It's a visually stunning animation that perfectly captures the theme of the skin.

Overall, Astronaut Xerath is a visually striking skin that offers a fresh take on the champion. It combines the power and elegance of Xerath with the awe-inspiring beauty of the cosmos, creating a truly unique and captivating skin.

Xerath: The Ascended Magus

Xerath is a mage champion in League of Legends known for his long-range abilities and immense magical power. Once a mortal mage, Xerath sought to unlock the secrets of immortality and ascension. However, his thirst for power led him down a dark path, and he became trapped in his own magical prison.

In the game, Xerath is a high-risk, high-reward champion. His long-range abilities allow him to poke and harass enemies from a safe distance, making him a formidable force in team fights. However, Xerath is also incredibly fragile and lacks mobility, making him vulnerable to assassins and champions who can close the gap quickly.

Xerath's abilities revolve around his mastery of arcane energy. His Q ability, Arcanopulse, fires a long-range skillshot that damages all enemies in its path. His W ability, Eye of Destruction, creates an expanding area of effect that damages and slows enemies caught in its radius. Xerath's E ability, Shocking Orb, fires an orb that stuns the first enemy hit, while his ultimate ability, Rite of the Arcane, allows him to unleash a barrage of long-range energy blasts.

Despite his weaknesses, Xerath can be a devastating force in the hands of a skilled player. His long-range poke and burst damage make him a potent threat in the mid-lane, where he can safely farm and harass his opponents. In team fights, Xerath excels at dealing damage from a distance, using his abilities to whittle down the enemy team before they can engage.

Throughout his time in League of Legends, Xerath has received several skins, each offering a unique visual and thematic twist. From the dark and menacing Battlecast Xerath to the regal and elegant Guardian of the Sands Xerath, players have a variety of options to choose from to suit their personal style.

For more information about Xerath and his various appearances, including videos showcasing his abilities and skins, be sure to visit our dedicated Xerath page. Whether you prefer the cosmic beauty of Astronaut Xerath or the raw power of his classic skin, Xerath is a champion that will leave a lasting impression on the Rift.

Xerath: The Magus Ascendant

Release Date: October 5, 2011

Xerath, the Magus Ascendant, is a powerful mage hailing from the ancient Shuriman empire in the world of League of Legends. With his mastery over arcane energies, Xerath wields immense power, capable of decimating his enemies from afar. His story, abilities, strengths, and weaknesses make him a formidable champion on the Fields of Justice.

Background

Xerath's tale begins in the golden era of Shurima, a once-mighty empire that spanned the vast desert. He was once a mortal mage, serving as a guardian of the Sun Disc, a powerful artifact that channeled the sun's energy to sustain the empire. However, consumed by his insatiable thirst for power, Xerath sought to harness the Sun Disc's energy for himself.

In a treacherous act of betrayal, Xerath attempted to overthrow Azir, the emperor of Shurima, and seize the Sun Disc's power. But his plan backfired, resulting in a cataclysmic explosion that destroyed the empire and transformed Xerath into an ethereal being of pure arcane energy. Bound to his mortal form by ancient magic, Xerath became an eternal prisoner, trapped within his own magical shackles.

Centuries later, Xerath was inadvertently released from his confinement during a Noxian excavation in Shurima. Now free, he seeks to unleash his newfound power upon the world, seeking revenge against those who imprisoned him and reclaiming his place as the Magus Ascendant.

Abilities

Xerath's abilities revolve around his mastery of arcane energy, allowing him to rain destruction upon his enemies from a safe distance. His kit consists of the following:

Passive: Mana Surge

After casting three spells, Xerath's next basic attack restores mana and grants him increased attack speed. This passive encourages Xerath players to weave in basic attacks between spellcasting to maximize their damage output and sustain in prolonged fights.

Q: Arcanopulse

Xerath charges up and fires a long-range skillshot, dealing magic damage to all enemies hit. This ability is Xerath's primary source of poke and wave clear, allowing him to harass opponents from a safe distance and control the battlefield.

W: Eye of Destruction

Xerath conjures an area of magical energy that detonates after a brief delay, dealing damage to all enemies within. This ability provides Xerath with area-of-effect damage, making it useful for clearing minion waves and zoning enemies in team fights.

E: Shocking Orb

Xerath releases an orb of energy that stuns the first enemy hit and deals damage. This ability is crucial for Xerath's survivability, as it provides him with a reliable crowd control tool to fend off assassins or engage in team fights.

R: Rite of the Arcane

Xerath channels for a few seconds, transforming into a stationary state and gaining increased range on his abilities. During this time, he can unleash a barrage of long-range magic missiles, damaging all enemies in a targeted area. Xerath's ultimate ability allows him to unleash devastating long-range artillery strikes, making him a fearsome force in team fights and sieges.

Strengths and Weaknesses

Xerath's strengths lie in his long-range poke, wave clear, and ability to control team fights. His Q ability, Arcanopulse, allows him to harass opponents from a safe distance, making it difficult for enemies to engage on him. Additionally, his ultimate, Rite of the Arcane, provides him with immense burst damage and zoning potential, making him a threat in team fights and sieges.

However, Xerath also has his fair share of weaknesses. His immobility makes him vulnerable to assassins and champions with high mobility. Without proper positioning and vision control, Xerath can easily be caught out and eliminated. Additionally, his reliance on skillshots means that he requires precise aim to maximize his damage output. Missing crucial abilities can significantly reduce his effectiveness in fights.

Xerath's Place in the Game

Xerath is primarily played as a mid-lane mage in League of Legends. His long-range poke and wave clear make him an excellent choice for sieging objectives and controlling the map. Xerath excels in team fights, where he can safely unleash his devastating ultimate, decimating multiple enemies from afar.

His playstyle revolves around positioning and map awareness. Xerath players must maintain a safe distance from their opponents while constantly looking for opportunities to poke and harass. Vision control is crucial for Xerath, as it allows him to spot potential threats and avoid being caught out by assassins or ganks.

With his powerful abilities and strategic playstyle, Xerath offers a unique and satisfying experience for players who enjoy long-range mages and tactical gameplay.

Explore Xerath's Skins

On our website, you can access information and videos showcasing all of Xerath's skins. From the classic Ascended Xerath to the cosmic-themed Dark Star Xerath, each skin offers a unique visual and thematic experience. Discover the different looks and effects of Xerath's skins and choose the one that best suits your style.

Join Xerath on his quest for power and vengeance, and unleash the might of the Magus Ascendant on the Fields of Justice!

In this skin, Xerath is transformed into a fiery being, wreathed in flames and radiating an aura of pure destruction. His abilities are visually enhanced, with fiery effects and explosions that leave a trail of devastation in their wake.

The first noticeable change in this skin is Xerath's appearance. His once blue and ethereal form is now replaced by a fiery red and orange color scheme. Flames dance across his body, giving him an otherworldly and menacing presence. His eyes glow with an intense fiery light, reflecting the immense power he wields.

The abilities of Scorched Earth Xerath are also revamped to match his new fiery theme. His Q ability, Arcanopulse, sends out a searing beam of fire that scorches everything in its path. The W ability, Eye of Destruction, summons a fiery explosion that engulfs the target area, leaving nothing but ashes in its wake. Xerath's E ability, Shocking Orb, hurls a flaming orb that explodes upon impact, causing devastation to all nearby enemies. Finally, his ultimate ability, Rite of the Arcane, rains down a barrage of fiery meteors that decimate anything unfortunate enough to be caught in their path.

The sound effects of Scorched Earth Xerath further enhance the skin's theme. The crackling of flames and the roar of fire can be heard with each ability cast, immersing the player in the destructive power of Xerath. The voiceover for this skin is also modified, with Xerath's voice taking on a more sinister and commanding tone, befitting his newfound fiery form.

Xerath: The Magus Ascendant

Xerath's story within the world of League of Legends is one of power and imprisonment. Once a mortal mage, Xerath sought to unlock the secrets of arcane magic and ascend to godhood. However, his ambitions led him down a dark path, and he became consumed by his own power. In a desperate attempt to contain him, Xerath was imprisoned within a magical sarcophagus by his fellow mages.

Centuries passed, and Xerath's power continued to grow within his prison. Eventually, the sarcophagus was shattered, and Xerath was set free. Now, as the Magus Ascendant, he seeks to reclaim his lost power and exact revenge on those who imprisoned him. With his ability to manipulate arcane energy, Xerath is a formidable mage who can rain destruction upon his enemies from afar.

In the world of League of Legends, Xerath is known for his long-range abilities and immense burst damage. His Q ability, Arcanopulse, allows him to fire a long-range skillshot that deals damage to all enemies in its path. His W ability, Eye of Destruction, creates an area of effect explosion that damages and slows enemies caught within it. Xerath's E ability, Shocking Orb, hurls an orb that stuns and damages the first enemy hit. Finally, his ultimate ability, Rite of the Arcane, allows him to channel and fire a barrage of long-range energy bolts that deal massive damage.

However, Xerath's power comes at a cost. He is immobile while casting his abilities, making him vulnerable to crowd control and assassins who can close the gap quickly. Additionally, his abilities require precise aim and positioning to maximize their effectiveness. Xerath players must have good map awareness and positioning skills to stay safe while dealing devastating damage to their enemies.
